assigned_to_detail.name: nobody@mozilla.org
assigned_to_detail.real_name: Nobody; OK to take it and work on it

comments.text:
[Affected versions]: 
- 52.7.4esr (20180427222832)
- 61.0a1 (20180429220443)
- 60.0b16 (20180426170554)

[Affected platforms]:
- Ubuntu 16.04 x64
- Windows 10 x64
- macOS 10.13

[Steps to reproduce]:
1. Log in to https://www.pinterest.com
2. Open any picture and click on the “Send” button
3. Select the WhatsApp option 

[Expected result]:
- The WhatsApp Web is opening in a new tab.

[Actual result]:
- A “Something went wrong” popup window message is displayed after a few seconds.

[Regression range]:
- This is not a regression, I was able to reproduce this issue also on Firefox 25.0a1 (2013-07-31).

[Additional notes]:
- No error message is triggered inside the Browser console.
- This issue is not reproducible on Chrome.
comments.author: anca.soncutean@softvision.ro

comments.text:
The issue is still reproducible.

Tested with:
Browser / Version: Firefox Nightly 62.0a1 (2018-05-10)
Operating System: Windows 10 Pro
